com.xtructure.xevolution.evolution
Interface EvolutionStrategy<D,T>

Type Parameters:
D - type of data used in Genomes
T - phenotype of Genomes
All Superinterfaces:
EvolutionObject
All Known Subinterfaces:
NEATEvolutionStrategy<D,T>
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractEvolutionStrategy, AbstractNEATEvolutionStrategy, DummyEvolutionStrategy, EvolutionStrategyImpl, NEATEvolutionStrategyImpl
public interface EvolutionStrategy<D,T>
extends EvolutionObject

The EvolutionStrategy interface describes the methods used at the highest level of evolution. Classes implementing this interface run a population of Genomes through the evolutionary process, using the given EvolutionConfiguration, EvaluationStrategy, ReproductionStrategy, and SurvivalFilter.

The evolutionary process begins with a single initialization step, following by repeated epoch steps, until the termination condition in EvolutionConfiguration is satisfied by the Population or the EvolutionStrategy instance itself.

At the end of initialization and each epoch, a report is made of the state of the population at that time, which may include writing files to the give output directory.

Author:
Luis Guimbarda

Methods inherited from interface com.xtructure.xevolution.evolution.EvolutionObject
getLogger
 

Method Detail

initialize

void initialize(Population<D> population)
Performs an initial evaluation and any pre-evolution processing on the given Population. This method is intended to be called once, before any evolution takes place.

Parameters:
population - the collection of genomes to initialize

epoch

void epoch(Population<D> population)
Evolves the given Population via mutation or crossover, reevaluates it, and performs any other processing.

Parameters:
population - the collection of genomes to evolve for one generation

start

void start(Population<D> population)
Initializes the given Population, and repeatedly evolves it until the EvolutionConfiguration's termination condition is satisfied by this EvolutionStrategy or the given Population.

Parameters:
population - the collection of genomes to evolve

report

void report(Population<D> population)
Produces a report of the state of the given Population at the end of initialization or any epoch. If this EvolutionStrategy's output directory is non-null, then logs may be written there.

Parameters:
population - the population whose statistics are being reported
